clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacovigilance and Patient Compliance in Hypertensive Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Pharmacovigilance and Patient Compliance in Hypertensive Patients. Observational Study

brief_summary.textblock: Study to confirm the safety profile of telmisartan (benefit-risk ratio) under normal conditions of use after market launch and to supplement the present data on the safety of telmisartan. Furthermore to assess effectiveness of a single dose of telmisartan per day to control blood pressure for 24 hours, especially during the last few hours of the dosage interval. Additionally to evaluate compliance with treatment, as an indirect measurement, and to confirm the efficacy and possible risks associated with treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Assessment of changes in heart rate
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, up to 8 weeks after start of treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Assessment for patients with changes in laboratory values
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, up to 8 weeks after start of treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with adverse events
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 8 weeks after start of treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in mean systolic and diastolic blood pressure values
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, up to 8 weeks after start of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by means of ambulatory blood pressure monitoring (ABPM) over 24 hours

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in mean systolic and diastolic blood pressure values
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, up to 8 weeks after start of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Measured three times at intervals of two minutes with the patient seated and lying down for 5 minutes, using a sphygmomanometer

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of treatment compliance as percentage of tablets planned
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 8 weeks after start of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: (number of tablets taken / total number of days) x 100

study_pop.textblock: Outpatients over 18 years of age suffering non-secondary, essential hypertension, treated by general practitioners and/or specialists

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients of either sex over the age of 18 years suffering from non-secondary essential hypertension with values of at least 90 mmHg (diastolic) and 140 mmHg (systolic)
Exclusion Criteria:
- corresponding to the contraindications listed in the summary of product characteristics of the drug
